column1: 5	5	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-trump-university-idUSKCN10D2O8	Trump loses bid to end Trump University lawsuit before trial	"

SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. judge on Tuesday rejected Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's pretrial bid to throw out a lawsuit brought by Trump University students who said they were defrauded by its real-estate seminars.U.S. District Judge Gonzalo Curiel said in a written ruling that there was a ""genuine issue of material fact"" as to whether Trump knowingly participated in a scheme to cheat the students
column2: who paid up to $35
column3: 000 to learn Trump's real estate investing ""secrets"" from his ""hand-picked"" instructors.Curiel said there was extensive evidence Trump had not personally met
column4: interviewed or selected Trump University instructors.In a July 22 hearing
column5: Curiel tentatively denied the bid by Trump to dismiss the lawsuit in California
column6: one of three over the defunct Trump University venture.

column1: Trump's lawyers had argued that the lawsuit
column2: filed in 2013 in U.S. District Court for the Southern District of California
column3: should be dismissed because the New York real estate mogul
column4: though personally involved in developing the concept and curriculum
column5: relied on others to manage Trump University by the time the plaintiffs purchased seminars.Trump's lawyers claimed that references in marketing materials to ""secrets
column6: ""hand-picked"" instructors or ""university"" were sales ""puffery"" and there was no evidence Trump intended to defraud students.

column1: Separately
column2: Curiel rejected an effort to make public video excerpts of Trump testifying under oath. Trump's lawyers had fought against the release of the excerpts
column3: saying they would be exploited by the media and others during the presidential campaign.

column1: Trump set off an uproar in May when he accused Curiel of being biased against him because of the candidate's pledge to build a border wall between the United States and Mexico. Curiel was born in Indiana and is of Mexican descent. (Reporting by Jim Christie in San Francisco; Additional reporting by Karen Freifeld in New York; Editing by Richard Chang and Leslie Adler)"	['Trump'

NEW YORK/WASHINGTON Three senior officials with the Democratic National Committee have resigned
